title: Ticket #6365: daemons may not write out a core file when they get a fatal signal
description:
The dprintf setup code overwrites the signal handler for SIGSEGV and friends to a handler that doesn't use the google coredumper routines to write a core file. This code is in daemon_core_main. We should just use the daemon_core_main one.

Also, we should unconditionally use the google coredumper routines, not just if we're root.
remarks:
2017-Aug-07 10:10:19 by johnkn:
CODE_REVIEW this change breaks logging of stack traces in tools when they crash.

2017-Sep-06 10:40:15 by gthain:
Note that tools that don't define a TOOL_DEBUG filename try to create a file called "2>" in the current directory and writes the stack trace there.
